fr.sorbonne_u.components.reflection.interfaces

Interface IntrospectionI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentServiceI, OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ReflectionI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntrospectionConnector, IntrospectionInboundPort, IntrospectionOutboundPort, ReflectionConnector, ReflectionInboundPort, ReflectionOutboundPort

    public interface IntrospectionI
extends OfferedI, RequiredI
    The interface IntrospectionI defines the introspection services offered by the Basic Component Model.

    Description

    The Basic Component Model reflection facility is still under construction. The interface IntrospectionI mirrors to a large extent the interface ComponentI implemented by the abstract class AbstractComponent and exposes the methods that allow to consult the internal representation of the component.

    Created on : 2016-02-25

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • hasSerialisedExecution

        boolean hasSerialisedExecution()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        return true if the component guarantees a serialised execution of its services.

        In the baseline definition, this returns true if the component has its own threads and if the total number of threads is exactly one. A component can guarantee its serialised execution in other ways and then should redefine the method for example, by making all externally callable services implemented by synchronised methods.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if the component guarantees a serialised execution of its services.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.

      • getPortImplementedInterface

        java.lang.Class<?> getPortImplementedInterface(java.lang.String portURI)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        return the interface implemented by the port.

        Contract

         pre    this.notInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.TERMINATED})
 pre    portURI != null and this.isPortExisting(portURI)
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        portURI - URI of the component's port.
        Returns:
        the interface implemented by the port.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if such a port does not exist in the component.

      • isPortConnected

        boolean isPortConnected(java.lang.String portURI)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        true if the port with the given URI is connected, false otherwise.

        Contract

         pre    this.notInStateAmong(new ComponentStateI[]{ComponentState.TERMINATED})
 pre    portURI != null and this.isPortExisting(portURI)
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        portURI - URI of the component's port.
        Returns:
        true if the port with the given URI is connected.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if such a port does not exist in the component.
